meta_description: PW builds community through the arts and sciences to create an open and inspired world. Discover experimentation and production in art, science, music, and technology at PW.
hours_text:
## **Location and Hours**

Pioneer Works is located at 159 Pioneer Street in Red Hook, Brooklyn. Our galleries and garden are open Wednesday through Sunday, 12-6 pm. 

## **Accessibility**

We know access is an iterative and ongoing process. Please contact info@pioneerworks.org to share accessibility questions regarding your upcoming visit or feedback on our policy.

Everyone is welcome at Pioneer Works, and we strive to create an inviting and inclusive environment for all visitors. Our beloved 19th century building is now fully ADA accessible following a $12.7 million renovation completed in early 2025, which included installing a full-service elevator to connect all three floors, creating a wheelchair-accessible pathway in the garden, and adding accessible restrooms. These upgrades ensure the historic Red Hook cultural center provides an inclusive environment for artists, scientists, and community members of all abilities.

## **Safety Information**

There are medics and trained staff onsite for all of our programs—if you are ever feeling unsafe or uncomfortable, please let us know so we can assist you. Reach out to info@pioneerworks.org with questions or concerns.

## **Covid-19 Safety Warning**

The health and safety of our visitors and artists is our top priority. Proof of vaccination and masks are no longer required, except for select events at the artist’s request. If you test positive for Covid or feel sick, have a fever, cough, shortness of breath, sore throat, or tr...

accessibility_text:
JAN 16 - 18, 2026

past

**Location**  
NYU Skirball

566 LaGuardia Place New York, NY 10012

This performance contains nudity and erotic gestures that may not be appropriate for children.

[Past Event](https://nyuskirball.org/events/voyage-into-infinity/#tickets)

Originally conceived as a kinetic installation for Pioneer Works, NYU Skirball presents **Narcissister’s _Voyage Into Infinit_ y** as part of Under The Radar 2026—transforming the Center’s stage into a dynamic site of surreal feats, lo-fi magic, and theatrical pyrotechnics.

A feminist response to Peter Fischli and David Weiss’s iconic video _The Way Things Go_ , the performance centers female-presenting bodies as both agents and objects of fascination. With a live score by **Holland Andrews,** _Voyage Into Infinity_ features Narcissister’s signature blend of humor, critique, and visual spectacle, channeling raw energy and punk spirit. At its core, the artist’s iconic mask continues to provoke urgent questions around identity, beauty, and race.

_Director/Performer:_ Narcissister  
 _Additional Narcissister Performers_ : Effie Bowen, Jessica Emmanuel  
 _Music:_ Holland Andrews  
 _Band:_ Justin Frye, Austin Sley Julian, Gregory Fox  
 _Pyrotechnics Artist:_ Alex Podger  
 _Pyrotechnics Designer/Skirball iteration:_ Jeremy Chernick  
 _Finishing Director:_ Reginald Robeson  
 _Choreographer/Movement Director:_ Wanda Gala  
 _Lighting Design:_ Michael Zumbrun  
 _Costume Design:_ Narcissister and Karen Boyer
